image.altText: A phone screen showing social media apps.

props.synopsis: The government and opposition moved fast to ram through the bill before the end of the parliamentary year, sparking calls for more scrutiny from some Coalition MPs, independents and the Greens.

title.children: Children to be banned from social media from next year after parliament votes through world-first laws

image.altText: A woman speaking on a TV

props.synopsis: Australia's social media ban for children makes headlines around the world, including as far away as Russia, as articles question how it could work and whether similar laws would be introduced elsewhere.

title.children: 'This is very crazy': Social media ban for children in 'Land of Kangaroos' makes global headlines

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: Dozens of bills are set to pass the Senate in an end-of-year flurry of deals across the parliament.

title.children: Albanese clears the decks for early election after Greens breakthrough triggers bill rush

image.altText: pm courtyard social media

props.synopsis: The prime minister has lauded the passage of a world-first social media ban for children after the Senate's marathon late-night sitting. Follow live.Â

title.children: PM tells parents 'we've got your back' after social media ban passes

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PM to travel down 'other paths' to secure electoral reforms
PM celebrates the week that was
Migration bills pass, only the social media ban left

image.altText: PFAS firefighting foam

props.synopsis: Researchers of a new study into how a type of PFAS breaks down in the environment say their findings underline the need to better monitor a wider range of "forever chemicals".

title.children: Soon-to-be-banned 'forever chemical' more widespread than previously thought

image.altText: A white background is tiled with mobile versions of webstores. In the foreground are desktop versions

props.synopsis: An ABC NEWS Verify investigation has uncovered dozens of online clothing stores pretending to be high-end Australian fashion boutiques. Customers are sometimes shipped cheap, low-quality goods made in Asia, and sometimes, nothing at all.

title.children: We uncovered 57 online clothing shops trying to scam Australians. And theyâre just the tip of the iceberg

image.altText: Sun shines against power pole in NSW.

props.synopsis: The latest independent scorecard shows that Australia is falling behind in its bid to meet the government's legislated 2030 target.

title.children: Australia falls dramatically short of 2030 emissions reduction goal, latest independent scorecard shows

image.altText: Some US sailors in formation, walking past a submarine which is draped in American flags.

props.synopsis: Australia is expected to acquire three Virginia-class submarines in the 2030s as part of the agreement.

title.children: Concerns over future of AUKUS as $8.8 billion 'emergency funding' plea made for key submarine program

image.altText: A man walking on a road in front of a pile of rubble

props.synopsis: Israel's military said on Thursday it had detected "suspects" in several areas in southern Lebanon, calling this a violation of a ceasefire with Hezbollah.

title.children: Israel and Hezbollah accuse each other of breaching two-day-old ceasefire

image.altText: a couple posing with friends in the VIP section of a concert

props.synopsis: Property developer David McWilliams and his wife Laura Fullarton owned a sprawling property portfolio, drove luxury cars, and travelled the world, but their business empire was unravelling amid an ASIC investigation.

title.children: ASIC investigation unravels NDIS property developer's luxury life

image.altText: Home set up for making alcohol in Cambodia, 2014.

props.synopsis: The deaths of six backpackers, including two Australian teenagers, have highlighted the dangers of contaminated alcohol in South-East Asia. But it's a danger locals live with daily.Â

title.children: 'I miss him when it rains': The devastating impact of methanol poisonings across Asia

image.altText: Virat Kohli batting during a training session.

props.synopsis: India has dominated Australia in Test cricket for the past decade but as New Zealand recently showed the key to beating the Men in Blue may lie in players who hail from South Asia.

title.children: 'We take cricket with us': Why the face of Australian cricket must change

image.altText: Yusril Ihza Mahendra wearing a white shirt with sleeves leaning over a microphone and gesturing with his left hand

props.synopsis: A senior Indonesian minister says Jakarta could respect any Australian decision about what happens to Bali Nine members who return home in a proposed prisoner transfer deal.

title.children: Indonesian minister signals approval for potential release of Bali Nine on return to Australia

image.altText: Kristian White wears a navy suit and tie as he enters the NSW Supreme Court in Sydney

props.synopsis: Kristian White will not be sent to custody ahead of sentencing, after being found guilty of the manslaughter of 95-year-old Clare Nowland.

title.children: Cop who fatally tasered aged care resident will not be taken into custody before sentencing

image.altText: A woman with beige headphones and a tote bag walks past a shop window advertising 50 per cent off.

props.synopsis: Australians are set to spend almost $7 billion in just four days during this year's Black Friday-Cyber Monday sales, as the cost of living sees more shoppers eager to snap up a bargain.

title.children: 'The hunt for a bargain' will see Australians fork out almost $7 billion during Black Friday sales

image.altText: Clare Polkinghorne claps

props.synopsis: Before the Matildas took to the field against Brazil at Lang Park, Clare Polkinghorne was honoured with an emotional outpouring for love for what was her final game on home soil. But all she wanted to do was play football.

title.children: 'Let's get on with it': Tears, applause and a stoic attitude to the very end for a Matildas legend

image.altText: A politician cartoon showing dinosaurs arguing about nuclear and gas power.

props.synopsis: Upon being named the 2024 Political Cartoonist of the Year, Megan Herbert demanded a recount.

title.children: The best political cartoons of 2024 are on display at Old Parliament House

image.altText: Cbus super logo on a building

props.synopsis: The local share market is in the red after Wall Street remained closed and European stocks rose. Meanwhile, Cbus Chair Wayne Swan is appearing before a Senate committee to address questions about claim payout delays. Follow the day's events and insights on our markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls, Cbus chair Wayne Swan faces Senate grilling

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Interest rate cut now expected in May, not Feb: ANZ
Cbus chair Swan apologises ahead of Senate appearance

image.altText: A woman with a short brown bob and rounded glasses wearing a grey blazer sits in a room with a small microphone in front of her.

props.synopsis: RBA Governor Michele Bullock says Australia's strategy of reducing inflation without stoking too much unemployment is part of the reason why it looks different to peer economies right now.

title.children: Interest rates are being kept stable to protect employment, RBA governor says

image.altText: Clare Polkinghorne poses for a photo, looking over her shoulder with a gold backdrop

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Think you've been paying attention to the news?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A politician and a Matildas player retire while a police officer wrangles an animal

image.altText: couple toboganning

props.synopsis: The state government plans to relinquish control of Mount Baw Baw and Lake Mountain after years of financial woes.

title.children: Skiing industry shock as Victorian government puts snow resorts up for lease

image.altText: Nick Cave sits in a chair in a recording studio and makes a finger gun with his hand

props.synopsis: After almost a decade of deep grief, Nick Cave is finding joy again. And it shows.

title.children: Nick Cave loves frogs, and is ready to find joy in life again

image.altText: A dark-haired woman wearing sunglasses and holding a small baby wearing a jacket and beanie.

props.synopsis: You may love your work, but are you working too much? Despite a growing awareness of burnout and work-life balance, many of us still see working long hours as a badge of honour.

title.children: You've heard of AA meetings. Now Workaholics Anonymous is helping people with a different addiction

image.altText: Anthony Albanese uses his phone on the floor of the House of Represenatives.

props.synopsis: The prime minister personally intervened in the wrangling and deal-making as the government battled to get as much as possible of Labor's legislation passed in the chaotic dying days of 2024's parliamentary sitting.

title.children: Anthony Albanese gets down and dirty in deal making and breaking as Senate rushes to Christmas finish

image.altText: A white Powerball lotto ticket with a black logo and lottery numbers and red coding messages on each side

props.synopsis: The two entries were the only jackpot-winning tickets drawn among more than 3 million other prize-winning players.

title.children: Powerball $100 million lotto won by Queensland couple and mystery Melbourne entrant

image.altText: Teen girl with curly hair and tan skin looks down at her phone wearing a stripy jumper. There are social media icons next to her

props.synopsis: The government's new laws banning children under 16 from having an account with some social media platforms won't take effect for at least 12 months. So what will happen before then?

title.children: Australia's social media ban for children under 16 just became law. How it will work remains a mystery

image.altText: Two reconstructions of ancient human species side by side, one very ape looking the other a broad faced human-like head.

props.synopsis: Newly discovered fossil footprints indicate two different ancient human relatives walked upright around a muddy lake in Kenya.

title.children: Footprints suggest two types of ancient human relatives walked side by side 1.5 million years ago

image.altText: A man wearing a navy shirt and grey pants poses for the camera. He is in a raised wheelchair.

props.synopsis: For over a month now, people with a disability have been unable to use NDIS funding for seeking sex worker services. Lived-experience advocates say it's a step backward.

title.children: NDIS participants can no longer access sex worker services through funding. Advocates say it's a 'deep betrayal'

image.altText: A man in white military uniform steps down stairs after getting off a plane

props.synopsis: The confirmation of an investigation into Miao Hua and his suspension marks the latest chapter in a growing corruption scandal engulfing China's military elites.

title.children: Another top military official hand-picked by Xi Jinping under investigation for corruption

image.altText: A fatberg underneath Bellerine Street in Geelong.

props.synopsis: Blockages caused by 'fatbergs' â an accumulation of non-flushable items â are wreaking havoc on sewers across Victoria, costing ratepayers millions of dollars each year.

title.children: In a system flush with wet wipes, fatbergs are costing Victorian ratepayers millions of dollars a year

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses stands outside, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A whistleblower midwife who alleged dozens of patients had received unsafe maternity care at a Queensland hospital says she has been vindicated by a health watchdog's critical report into the state-run facility.Â

title.children: Whistleblower midwife who alleged maternity care failures says health watchdog's report vindicates her

image.altText: A wide shot of a bushfire burning in the distance at night.

props.synopsis: Efforts to control a bushfire threatening multiple coastal towns north of Perth have continued overnight, with hundreds of firefighters battling the blaze as some residents told it is too late to leave their homes.

title.children: Firefight continues as WA bushfire emergency enters fifth day
